title: Learning latent tree models with small query complexity
authors: Luc Devroye, Gabor Lugosi, Piotr Zwiernik
abstract:
We consider the problem of structure recovery in a graphical model of a tree
where some variables are latent. Specifically, we focus on the Gaussian case,
which can be reformulated as a well-studied problem: recovering a semi-labeled
tree from a distance metric. We introduce randomized procedures that achieve
query complexity of optimal order. Additionally, we provide statistical
analysis for scenarios where the tree distances are noisy. The Gaussian setting
can be extended to other situations, including the binary case and
non-paranormal distributions.
